data.event: In 1876 the Texas Land Company auctioned lots in anticipation of the arrival of the International-Great Northern Railroad when Taylor was founded that year.
In 1876 the Texas Land Company auctioned lots in anticipation of the arrival of the International-Great Northern Railroad when Taylor was founded that year.
The city was named after Edward Moses Taylor, a railroad official, under the name Taylorsville which officially became Taylor in 1892.

event.title: now the Czech Republic) and other Slavic states, as well as from Germany and Austria, helped

data.event: Immigrants from Moravia and Bohemia (now the Czech Republic) and other Slavic states, as well as from Germany and Austria, helped establish the town.

event.title: 1878 the town had 1,000 residents and thirty-two businesses, twenty-nine of which were destroyed

data.event: By 1878 the town had 1,000 residents and thirty-two businesses, twenty-nine of which were destroyed by fire in 1879.
By 1878 the town had 1,000 residents and thirty-two businesses, twenty-nine of which were destroyed by fire in 1879.

event.title: 1882 the Taylor, Bastrop and Houston Railway reached

data.event: In 1882 the Taylor, Bastrop and Houston Railway reached the community, and machine shops and a roundhouse serviced both rail lines.
In 1882 the town was incorporated with a mayor-council form of city government, and in 1883 a public school system replaced a number of private schools.
In 1882 the town was incorporated with a mayor-council form of city government, and in 1883 a public school system replaced a number of private schools.
